snippet: The prospect of Congress failing to raise the nation’s debt limit has economists and investors exploring options the White House might have.
abstract: Wall Street, with Washington preoccupied by the government shutdown, is shifting its attention to an even more worrisome situation: possibility that the government could run out of money within next few weeks, forcing an unprecedented default on its debt; economists and investors are exploring options White House might have in event Congress fails to act.

byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and CHARLIE SAVAGE

lead_paragraph: The prospect of Congress failing to raise the nation’s debt limit has economists and investors exploring options the White House might have.

headline.main: Wall St. Fears Go Beyond Shutdown
headline.print_headline: Wall St. Fears Go Beyond Shutdown
